TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Rīga . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was hit by a car while he was riding his bicycle . He was taken to hospital , where he was diagnosed with contusions of the head and jaw . He was released on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG ( PERSON pilsētas Galvenās PERSON nodaļa ) ( hereinafter “ the traffic police ” ) decided not to initiate criminal proceedings against the driver of the car . It was established that a passenger , to whom the driver was giving a lift , unexpectedly opened the door of the car , and the applicant hit the door . The identity of the passenger was not established .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against this decision to ORG office ( PERSON autotransporta prokuratūra ) , alleging that the driver knew the passenger and thus could identify him . The applicant also complained that he had sustained health problems in the accident .

CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor attached to ORG office quashed the earlier decision and returned the case for additional investigation . Another decision not to institute criminal proceedings was adopted on DATE , but this too was later quashed . Various forensic medical and technical expert assessments were carried out throughout the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor of ORG office informed the applicant that , according to the provisions of LAW , he could not have access to the decisions regarding the expert assessments .
CARDINAL . On DATE the traffic police informed the applicant that the passenger had been identified .

CARDINAL . On DATE the traffic police adopted a decision not to institute criminal proceedings and informed the applicant about it . The decision described in detail the circumstances of the accident and referred to the outcomes of the forensic medical and technical assessments . It concluded that the passenger had violated section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see Relevant domestic law below ) , and that his wrongful act was the cause of the traffic accident . It also referred to the fact that the applicant had sustained minor injuries . The passenger was administratively fined in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) .
CARDINAL . After examining the applicant ’s appeals in which he contested the decision not to institute criminal proceedings on CARDINAL and DATE ORG upheld the earlier decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to inform him where and when he could get acquainted with the materials in the file relating to the traffic accident . On DATE the applicant was informed that pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW he has to submit an identical request to the investigating authority .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , circumstances which have to be proved during pre - trial investigation include , inter alia , the amount of pecuniary loss suffered as a result of a crime .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL stipulates that a civil claim may be submitted by persons who have suffered damage as a result of a crime . A civil claim may be brought against an accused or against a person who is vicariously liable for the acts of the accused . A person shall have the right to lodge a civil claim by way of civil proceedings if a claim has not been brought in criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . According to LAW , a person who has suffered damage as a result of a crime can be declared a civil party during pre - trial investigation .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL stipulates that if a civil claim is left unexamined , a victim shall have the right to file the same claim by way of civil proceedings .
CARDINAL . Section QUANTITY provides that a complaint about public ORG actions can be submitted to a hierarchically superior prosecutor .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL § CARDINAL , civil claims for compensation for pecuniary or non - pecuniary damage in criminal matters may be brought in accordance with the procedures prescribed by LAW .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL stipulates that every wrongful act or failure to act per se shall give the person who has suffered damage thereby the right to claim compensation from the wrongdoer , in so far as he or she may be held liable for that act .
CARDINAL . Other relevant provisions of LAW applicable at the material time , and other relevant matters are to be found in GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL , pedestrians who have violated traffic rules and caused a traffic accident or minor injuries to a victim shall be fined in an amount from CARDINAL to QUANTITY ) .

CARDINAL . According to section CARDINAL , a victim is a person to whom non - pecuniary , physical or material harm has been caused by an administrative violation . The victim has the right to , inter alia , be familiarised with all the materials in the proceedings , to submit requests and to appeal against the decision in administrative offence proceedings .
